com.github.kislayverma.rulette

Class RuleSystem

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.kislayverma.rulette.RuleSystem
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    public class RuleSystem
extends Object
implements Serializable
    This class models a rule-system comprising of rules and provides appropriate APIs to interact with it. Sample usage 
     
 RuleSystem rs = new RuleSystem("rule system name");
 Rule r = rs.getRule(25L);
    Author:
    Kislay Verma
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • RuleSystem

        public RuleSystem()
        This constructor is added only to support unit testing. Should not be used.

      • RuleSystem

        public RuleSystem(String ruleSystemName)
           throws Exception
        This constructor accepts a path to a text file containing the following values on separate lines: 1. Name of the rule system 2. Full path of the file containing the rules
        Parameters:
        ruleSystemName - name of the rule system to initialize
        Throws:
        Exception - on rule system initialization failure

      • RuleSystem

        public RuleSystem(String ruleSystemName,
                  IDataProvider dataProvider)
           throws Exception
        This constructor initializes a rule system of the given name by reading data from the credentials given in the data source URL. All rule input will be initiatized with default parameters and no custom data types will be supported.
        Parameters:
        ruleSystemName - Name of the rule system to be instantiated
        dataProvider -
        Throws:
        Exception - on rule system initialization failure

      • RuleSystem

        public RuleSystem(String ruleSystemName,
                  IDataProvider dataProvider,
                  RuleInputConfigurator inputConfig)
           throws Exception
        This constructor initializes a rule system of the given name by reading data from the credentials given in the data source URL. Rule input will be initiatized with default parameters unless an override is provided via the inputConfig parameter. Custom data type will be supported only if appropriate configuration is provided.
        Parameters:
        ruleSystemName - Name of the rule system to be instantiated
        dataProvider -
        inputConfig - Configuration to support custom data types and behaviour for rule inputs
        Throws:
        Exception - if rule system could not be initialized

    • Method Detail

      • createRuleObject

        public Rule createRuleObject(Map<String,String> inputMap)
                      throws Exception
        Throws:
        Exception

      • getAllRules

        public List<Rule> getAllRules()
        This method returns a list of all the rules in the rule system.
        Returns:
        List of all rules configured in the rule system

      • getAllApplicableRules

        public List<Rule> getAllApplicableRules(Map<String,String> inputMap)
                                 throws Exception
        This method returns a list of all the rules in the rule system.
        Parameters:
        inputMap - map of rule input values for which applicable rules are to be returned
        Returns:
        List of all rules applicable to the given input
        Throws:
        Exception - if rule evaluation fails

      • getRule

        public Rule getRule(Object request)
             throws Exception
        This method returns the rule applicable for the given combination of rule inputs.
        Parameters:
        request - A simple Object with @RuletteInput annotation on required fields values
        Returns:
        null if input is null, null if no rule is applicable for the given input combination the applicable rule otherwise.
        Throws:
        Exception - on rule evaluation error

      • getRule

        public Rule getRule(Map<String,String> inputMap)
             throws Exception
        This method returns the rule applicable for the given combination of rule inputs.
        Parameters:
        inputMap - Map with input names as keys and their String values as values
        Returns:
        null if input is null, null if no rule is applicable for the given input combination the applicable rule otherwise.
        Throws:
        Exception - on rule evaluation error

      • getRule

        public Rule getRule(Integer ruleId)
        This method returns the applicable rule for the given input criteria.
        Parameters:
        ruleId - Unique id of the rule to get looked up.
        Returns:
        A Rule object if a rule with the given id exists. null otherwise.

      • addRule

        public Rule addRule(Map<String,String> inputMap)
             throws Exception
        This method adds a new rule to the rule system. There is no need to provide the rule_id field in the input - it will be auto-populated.
        Parameters:
        inputMap - The rule input values for which a new rule is to be added
        Returns:
        the added rule if there are no overlapping rules null if there are overlapping rules null if the input constitutes an invalid rule as per the validation policy in use.
        Throws:
        Exception - on failure

      • addRule

        public Rule addRule(Rule newRule)
             throws Exception
        This method adds the given rule to the rule system with a new rule id.
        Parameters:
        newRule - The new rule to be added
        Returns:
        the added rule if there are no overlapping rules null if there are overlapping rules null if the input constitutes an invalid rule as per the validation policy in use.
        Throws:
        Exception - on failure

      • updateRule

        public Rule updateRule(Rule oldRule,
                       Rule newRule)
                throws Exception
        This method updates an existing rules with values of the new rule given. All fields are updated of the old rule are updated. The new rule is checked for conflicts before update.
        Parameters:
        oldRule - An existing rule
        newRule - The rule containing the new field values to which the old rule will be updated.
        Returns:
        the updated rule if update creates no conflict. null if the input constitutes an invalid rule as per the validation policy in use.
        Throws:
        Exception - if there are overlapping rules if the old rules does not actually exist.

      • deleteRule

        public boolean deleteRule(Integer ruleId)
                   throws Exception
        This method deletes an existing rule from the rule system.
        Parameters:
        ruleId - Unique id of the rule to be deleted
        Returns:
        true if the rule with given rule id was successfully deleted false if the given rule does not exist false if the given rule could not be deleted (for whatever reason).
        Throws:
        Exception - on error in deleting rule

      • deleteRule

        public boolean deleteRule(Rule rule)
                   throws Exception
        This method deleted the given rule from the rule system.
        Parameters:
        rule - The Rule to be deleted.
        Returns:
        true if the given rule was successfully deleted false if the given rule does not exist false if the given rule could not be deleted (for whatever reason).
        Throws:
        Exception - on failure

      • getConflictingRules

        public List<Rule> getConflictingRules(Rule rule)
                               throws Exception
        This method returns a list of rules conflicting with the given rule.
        Parameters:
        rule - Rule object
        Returns:
        List of conflicting rules if any, empty list otherwise.
        Throws:
        Exception - on rule evaluation failure

      • getNextApplicableRule

        public Rule getNextApplicableRule(Map<String,String> inputMap)
                           throws Exception
        This method returns the next rule that will be applicable to the inputs if the current rule applicable to the were to be deleted.
        Parameters:
        inputMap - Map with column Names as keys and column values as values.
        Returns:
        A Rule object if a rule is applicable after the currently applicable rule is deleted. null if no rule is applicable after the currently applicable rule is deleted. null id no rule is currently applicable.
        Throws:
        Exception - on rule evaluation failure

        public String getUniqueColumnName()

      • getOutputColumnName

        public String getOutputColumnName()

      • getName

        public String getName()
        Returns the name of the rule system
        Returns:
        the name of the rule system

      • getAllColumnNames

        public List<String> getAllColumnNames()
        Returns the names of all the columns in the rule system, including the unique input and output column names
        Returns:
        names of all the columns in the rule system

      • getInputColumnNames

        public List<String> getInputColumnNames()
        Returns the names of all the columns in the rule system, excluding the unique input and output column names
        Returns:
        names of all columns for evaluation in the rule system
